**Logistics and Recovery Services - Stratospheric Balloon in Nunavut, 2024**
==========================================================================================================================

**Official Reference:** CB-855-13423325

**Amendment Number:** 3
**Solicitation Number:** 9F064-23-0467
**Notice Published:** May 15, 2024

**Tender Closing Date:** May 30, 2024, 02:00 PM (EDT)

**Service Contract Overview**
-----------------------------

The Canadian Space Agency (CSA) invites Inuit firms to submit a proposal for the provision of logistics and recovery services in support of a stratospheric balloon mission in Nunavut, 2024.

**Service Requirements**
-------------------------

The successful bidder will be required to provide a range of logistics and recovery services, including:

* Transportation of a stratospheric balloon and its payload from Iqaluit to Baffin Island
* Recovery of the balloon and its payload following a transatlantic flight
* Support for a scientific gondola and its payload during the flight
* Ensuring compliance with relevant Nunavut Agreement and environmental regulations

**Supplier Eligibility and Selection Criteria**
-----------------------------------------------

This procurement is subject to the Nunavut Agreement and is open to Inuit firms registered on the Inuit Firm Registry (IFR). Suppliers must meet the required selection criteria, which includes a highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

**Proposal Submission Guidelines**
----------------------------------

Proposals must be submitted by May 30, 2024, 02:00 PM (EDT). The successful bidder will be required to demonstrate their ability to meet the service requirements and comply with the necessary regulations.

**Contracting Authority and Contact Information**
-------------------------------------------------

Amélie Beaulieu
Canadian Space Agency
Contact email: amelie.beaulieu@asc-csa.gc.ca
Phone: (438) 468-6070
